org.eclipse.gef4.fx.gestures

Class AbstractMouseDragGesture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef4.fx.gestures.AbstractGesture
      • org.eclipse.gef4.fx.gestures.AbstractMouseDragGesture

  • public abstract class AbstractMouseDragGesture
extends AbstractGesture
    An FXMouseDragGesture can be used to listen to mouse press, drag, and release events. In order to use it, you have to subclass it and implement the press(Node, MouseEvent), drag(Node, MouseEvent, double, double), and release(Node, MouseEvent, double, double) methods.

      AbstractMouseDragGesture()

      protected void onMouseEvent(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)

      Called when a Scene is provided.

    • Method Detail

      • drag

        protected abstract void drag(javafx.scene.Node target,
                             javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                             double dx,
                             double dy)
        This method is called upon MouseEvent.MOUSE_DRAGGED events.
        Parameters:
        target - The event target.
        event - The corresponding MouseEvent.
        dx - The horizontal displacement from the mouse press location.
        dy - The vertical displacement from the mouse press location.

      • getPressed

        public javafx.scene.Node getPressed()
        Returns the currently pressed Node.
        Returns:
        The currently pressed Node.

      • onMouseEvent

        protected void onMouseEvent(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method is called for *any* MouseEvent that occurs in the Scene where this gesture is currently registered. It processes MouseEvent.MOUSE_DRAGGED and MouseEvent.MOUSE_RELEASED events if the gesture was previously initiated (pressed node is known).
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent to process.

      • press

        protected abstract void press(javafx.scene.Node target,
                              javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method is called upon MouseEvent.MOUSE_PRESSED events.
        Parameters:
        target - The event target.
        event - The corresponding MouseEvent.

      • register

        protected void register()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGesture
        Called when a Scene is provided. The new Scene can be obtained via AbstractGesture.getScene(). Event handlers are registered here.
        Specified by:
        register in class AbstractGesture

      • release

        protected abstract void release(javafx.scene.Node target,
                                javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                                double dx,
                                double dy)
        This method is called upon MouseEvent.MOUSE_RELEASED events. This method is also called for other mouse events, when a mouse release event was not fired, but was detected otherwise (probably only possible when using the JavaFX/SWT integration).
        Parameters:
        target - The event target.
        event - The corresponding MouseEvent.
        dx - The horizontal displacement from the mouse press location.
        dy - The vertical displacement from the mouse press location.

      • unregister

        protected void unregister()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGesture
        Called when the Scene is removed. You can obtain the old Scene via AbstractGesture.getScene() so that event handlers can be unregistered.
        Specified by:
        unregister in class AbstractGesture
